description: PAPA is a flexible agent for pleiotropic pathway analysis utilizing GWAS summary results.
name: PAPA

metadata.abstract: Â© 2015 The Author 2015. Published by Oxford University Press. All rights reserved.Summary: Pleiotropy is common in the genetic architectures of complex diseases. To the best of our knowledge, no analysis agent has been developed for identifying pleiotropic pathways using multiple genome-wide association study (GWAS) summaries by now. Here, we present PAPA, a flexible agent for pleiotropic pathway analysis utilizing GWAS summary results. The performance of PAPA was validated using publicly available GWAS summaries of body mass index and waist-hip ratio of the GIANT datasets. PAPA identified a set of pleiotropic pathways, which have been demonstrated to be involved in the development of obesity. Availability and implementation: PAPA program, document and illustrative example are available at http://sourceforge.net/projects/papav1/files/. Contact: Supplementary information: Supplementary data are available at Bioinformatics online.
metadata.title: PAPA: A flexible agent for identifying pleiotropic pathways using genome-wide association study summaries
